items.title: Taking Stock: Market ends with modest gain amid high volatility; Nifty gains 3% in Feb expiry
items.content: Adani Enterprises, Tata Consumer, MM, IndusInd Bank and Adani Ports were among the top gainers on the Nifty, while losers were Apollo Hospitals, Bajaj Auto, LTIMindtree, Eicher Motors and UPL.
items.contentSnippet: Adani Enterprises, Tata Consumer, MM, IndusInd Bank and Adani Ports were among the top gainers on the Nifty, while losers were Apollo Hospitals, Bajaj Auto, LTIMindtree, Eicher Motors and UPL.

items.title: Nifty, Sensex lack direction on monthly FO expiry; investors cautious ahead of GDP data
items.content: BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices were trading marginally higher. Sectorally, Nifty PSU Bank led the gains, rising over 1 percent.

items.title: Mid-day Mood| Nifty, Sensex flat ahead of GDP data, banks under pressure
items.content: Markets are cautious ahead of the release of India’s Q3 GDP data.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty flat amid weak global cues; volatility likely ahead of monthly expiry
items.content: Analysts expect volatility to continue through the day ahead of monthly expiry, with Nifty facing a strong resistance at 22,000-mark

items.title: Taking Stock: Sensex tanks 790 points, Nifty below 22,000; small, midcaps singed
items.content: Biggest Nifty losers included Power Grid Corporation, Apollo Hospitals, Eicher Motors and Maruti Suzuki, while HUL, Infosys, TCS and Bharti Airtel were among the gainers
items.contentSnippet: Biggest Nifty losers included Power Grid Corporation, Apollo Hospitals, Eicher Motors and Maruti Suzuki, while HUL, Infosys, TCS and Bharti Airtel were among the gainers

items.title: Nifty, Sensex fall over 1%; here#39;s what dragged indices today
items.content: BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices fell over 1.5 percent amid reports that SEBI has urged asset managers to provide investors with more information on the risks associated with their small and mid-cap funds.
items.contentSnippet: BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices fell over 1.5 percent amid reports that SEBI has urged asset managers to provide investors with more information on the risks associated with their small and mid-cap funds.

items.title: Midcap, smallcap stocks burnt by SEBI eye on mutual fund flows, profit booking; Zee, Voda Idea worst hit
items.content: This correction in the broader market is healthy, it will pull some counters out of the overbought zone, say analysts

items.title: Mid-day Mood | Indices float in losses as heavyweight banks drag; small and midcaps bleed
items.content: Investors refrained from placing any aggressive bets in the anticipation of the release of the US personal expenditures price index print, due on Thursday.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty flat, volatility to remain high ahead of monthly expiry
items.content: Analysts say volatility is likely to continue ahead of the monthly expiry but see the possibility of the Nifty hitting an all-time high

items.title: Taking Stock: Market recovers with Nifty near 22,200, Sensex gains 305 pts
items.content: Among sectors, Auto, Capital Goods, Information Technology, Pharma, Realty rose 0.5-1 percent each, while Oil Gas index was down 1 percent.
items.contentSnippet: Among sectors, Auto, Capital Goods, Information Technology, Pharma, Realty rose 0.5-1 percent each, while Oil  Gas index was down 1 percent.

items.title: Heavyweights help Sensex snap 2-day fall; analysts see Nifty at 22,700 in coming weeks
items.content: Market analysts expect the Nifty to scale new all-time highs in the coming weeks, provided it stays above the 21,990 level
items.contentSnippet: Market analysts expect the Nifty to scale new all-time highs in the coming weeks, provided it stays above the 21,990 level

items.title: Mid-day Mood | Subdued global cues, wait for US inflation data keep Sensex, Nifty lacklustre
items.content: Caution persisted in the market ahead of the weekly derivatives expiry and release of the US inflation data, both due on Thursday.
items.contentSnippet: Caution persisted in the market ahead of the weekly derivatives expiry and release of the US inflation data, both due on Thursday.

items.title: Heavyweight stocks pull Nifty, Sensex marginally up; analysts expect rangebound trade
items.content: Analysts expects the market to remain rangebound over the next few sessions in the absence of immediate triggers
